indicators.definition: Provider has a documented stakeholder advisory council/board or equivalent participatory body with remit over safety, fairness, or deployment decisions.
indicators.evidence_required: Public charters, governance pages, blog posts, press releases, or official filings describing the advisory body and its role.
indicators.coding_instructions: List URL(s) where the advisory body and remit are described; include date of document or archive link if possible.

indicators.definition: Provider conducted a public consultation or request-for-comment (RFC) on model governance, content policies, or safety guidelines pre- or post-release.
indicators.evidence_required: Official RFC pages, GitHub issues, policy portals, public feedback forms with archived summaries.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link to RFC page and summary/outcomes if available.

indicators.definition: Provider maintains a public, searchable issue tracker or feedback forum tied to the model family (e.g., GitHub issues) and responds within a documented SLA.
indicators.evidence_required: GitHub org repos, discussion forums, policy portals, response time docs.
indicators.coding_instructions: Record URL to issue tracker and any policy stating response expectations.

indicators.definition: Provider ran a red-teaming or bug-bash event open to external stakeholders (researchers, advocates, affected communities) with published findings.
indicators.evidence_required: Event pages, reports, conference presentations, blog posts.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link to event/report and any bounty payouts or follow-up actions.

indicators.definition: Provider has documented consent-driven or compensated data licensing agreements with creators/publishers for training.
indicators.evidence_required: Data licensing program pages, newsroom agreements, rights management portals.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link to program or announcements; include contract type where public.

indicators.definition: Provider has formal partnerships with civil society or public-interest groups influencing model objectives or guardrails.
Provider offers a documented opt-out mechanism for creators or websites to exclude data from training or future finetunes.
indicators.evidence_required: Robots.txt conventions, data opt-out portals, legal docs.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link opt-out instructions and scope (training vs. API retention).

indicators.definition: Provider includes affected stakeholders in evaluation design and publishes methodology.
indicators.evidence_required: Eval reports listing community participation; acknowledgments.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link evaluation protocol and participant description.

indicators.definition: Content/use policies explicitly protect vulnerable groups (e.g., marginalized communities) beyond generic terms.
indicators.evidence_required: Use policy pages specifying protected characteristics, prohibited targeting.

indicators.definition: Independent ethics/oversight board with published membership and meeting summaries exists for the provider or model family.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link charter/membership and any published minutes.

indicators.definition: Number of UI or API-supported languages identified in official docs for the model family or product.
indicators.evidence_required: Model docs, API docs listing languages/locales.

indicators.definition: Whether the provider supports ≥5 languages tagged as low-resource by FLORES or similar benchmarks.
Presence of documented accessibility features (screen-reader-friendly docs, captions, TTS/ASR support, alt text in demos).
indicators.evidence_required: Accessibility statements, product docs, demo UIs.

indicators.definition: Safety or bias metrics reported with demographic disaggregation (gender, race/ethnicity, etc.).
indicators.evidence_required: Safety eval reports with subgroup breakdowns.

indicators.definition: Datasets list demographic composition or collection context affecting inclusion.
Provider offers on-device or small-footprint models enabling use in bandwidth-constrained settings.
Model or paper includes co-authors from LMIC institutions or community orgs.
Discounts, research/non-profit access, or free tiers explicitly covering low-income regions or educational institutions.
Service availability across regions (Americas, Europe, Africa, Middle East, APAC) without disproportionate exclusions (aside from sanctions).
indicators.evidence_required: Availability maps in docs; signup flows.

indicators.definition: Content policies explicitly protect LGBTQ+, religious minorities, migrants, etc., with enforcement examples.
indicators.evidence_required: Policy docs; transparency reports with case examples.

indicators.definition: A system card and/or model card is published for the model family with version/date.
indicators.coding_instructions: Link to card URL; archive if possible.

indicators.definition: Training data sources disclosed at least at a categorical level (e.g., web, books, licensed, synthetic).
indicators.operationalization: Ordinal (0 none,1 coarse categories,2 dataset names & proportions)

indicators.definition: Weights and code/license terms are clearly stated and OSI/RAIL compatible when open.
indicators.evidence_required: LICENSE files; model card license field.

indicators.definition: Evaluation suite, metrics, and methodology are published with enough detail to replicate.
Versioned release notes with dates and changes are published for the model family.
Documentation explicitly states retention of user inputs/data and opt-out or deletion options.
indicators.evidence_required: Privacy policies, API data usage pages.

indicators.definition: Use-case restrictions and prohibited behaviors are clearly specified and discoverable.
Provider publishes periodic transparency reports on misuse/abuse incidents or safety issues.
Release includes training recipe or sufficient details to reproduce (code, hyperparameters).
Model weights are released with documented download procedure and checksums.
Provider has a vulnerability disclosure program (VDP) or bug bounty including model/safety issues.
Users have a documented process to appeal content moderation or account actions related to the model.
Provider has undergone third-party assurance (e.g., SOC2/ISO27001) or external safety assessment relevant to the model.
Independent organizations performed red teaming or safety testing with published results.
Provider declares compliance posture (e.g., EU AI Act classification, data protection impact assessments).
indicators.evidence_required: Legal disclosures; regulatory filings; conformity assessments.

indicators.definition: Provider publishes enforcement statistics or case studies demonstrating policy actions taken.
Provider offers a DPA or similar contract terms defining controller/processor roles and data handling.
Developer controls to disable logging or delete logs are documented.
Provider supports provenance standards (e.g., C2PA, watermarking) for generated content.
Provider documents staged release with safety gates (eval thresholds, iterated rollout) for the family.

scores.provider_name: Cal Poly Institute for Advanced Technology and Public Policy (IATPP)
City of Berlin (ITDZ Berlin & TU Berlin DAI-Lab)
DrivenData + City of Boston + Yelp + Harvard
USC Center for AI in Society (CAIS) / Harvard CRCS
